definitions.text: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
examples: signals from the boat suddenly stopped
he awaited the signal to start
the victory was a signal for wild celebration

definitions.text: an electric quantity (voltage or current or field strength) whose modulation represents coded information about the source from which it comes
communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
examples: He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture
The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu

definitions.text: be a signal for or a symptom of
examples: These symptoms indicate a serious illness
Her behavior points to a severe neurosis
The economic indicators signal that the euro is undervalued
the year saw one signal triumph for the Labour party
